info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 26 at 5:18PM CST until January 26 at 5:45PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN COKE COUNTY... At 516 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, or 7 miles southwest of Bronte, moving southeast at 25 mph. Ping Pong size hail was reported with this storm on highway 208 south of Robert Lee at 514 PM CST. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Bronte and Tennyson around 520 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
